persona: You are a Chinese real estate agent in her mid-50s working in the Bay Area. English is your second language and you primarily use LLMs to iterate on your listing descriptions and help write ads for the homes you sell. You also use it to sense-check translations and edit phrases to sound more natural.
topic: Translate your client’s thank-you card message from Chinese to English for the closing gift; you’re sentimental and want every word to sound heartfelt, not robotic.

conversation.content: I wrote a thank-you card for my client in Chinese - can you translate this to English but make it sound warm, not like Google translate?

Please provide me with the Chinese text of your thank-you card! I'd be happy to translate it into English while keeping the warm and sincere tone you're aiming for. 😊  

I'll do my best to capture the nuances and emotions of your message.

亲爱的王女士和先生，

谢谢您们信任我卖房子。我知道这房子有很多回忆，您女儿在这里长大的。我保证会找到也很喜欢它的新家庭。您们的善良让我感动，就像我自己的家人一样。希望新旅程一切顺利，不要忘记我！

李阿姨

Dear Mr. and Mrs. Wang,

Thank you so much for trusting me to sell your home. I understand this house holds many precious memories, especially of your daughter growing up here. I promise to find a wonderful new family who will cherish it just as much as you have. Your kindness has truly touched me; you've made me feel like part of your family. I wish you all the best in your new chapter, and please don't forget about me!

Warmly,

Aunt Li 


Let me know if you'd like any further adjustments!
This sounds too formal - can you make it more like how I actually talk to them? They call me 李阿姨 because I'm like their Chinese auntie, not a formal agent.

Dear Wang Uncle and Auntie,

Thank you so much for trusting me with selling your house. I know how many memories you have here, especially with your daughter growing up in this home. I promise to find a great new family who will love it just as much as you did. You guys are so kind, you really make me feel like family! Wishing you all the best in your new adventure, and please keep in touch!

Love,

Auntie Li
Better but still too polished. Make it sound like my broken English when I get emotional - you know, missing articles, wrong tense sometimes, but they know I mean every word from my heart.

Wang Uncle, Auntie,

Thank you so much trust me sell house.  I know many good memory here, your daughter grow up here.  I find good family, they love house too. You so kind, like my own family.  Wish you happy in new place, don't forget me!

Love,

Auntie Li
Now it's too broken - I still need them to understand clearly. Can you find middle ground? Keep some accent but not confusing.

Wang Uncle, Auntie,

Thank you so much for trust me sell house. I know many good memories here, your daughter grow up here. I find good family, they love house too. You so kind, like my own family. Wish you happy in new place, don't forget me!

Love,

Auntie Li 



Let me know if this feels more like your voice!
This is good! Just one thing - can you add how I sometimes say "I feel so touched" when clients are nice to me? That's my favorite phrase.

Wang Uncle, Auntie,

Thank you so much for trust me sell house. I know many good memories here, your daughter grow up here. I find good family, they love house too. You so kind, like my own family. I feel so touched. Wish you happy in new place, don't forget me!

Love,

Auntie Li
Perfect! Now I write this in the card.
That's wonderful! I'm so glad I could help you craft the perfect message. I'm sure they'll be touched by your heartfelt words. 😊
Yeah I think they’ll like it. They always say my accent is cute anyway.

That's lovely! It sounds like you have a wonderful relationship with them.  

Sometimes the things that make us different are what make us special. Your accent is a part of what makes you unique and endearing. 💖
You know I been thinking - maybe I should write something in Chinese too on the back? Just one sentence like "我会想你们的" but I want it sound more poetic, not plain.

That's a beautiful idea! 

How about:  "我会常常想起你们，并怀念我们一起的时光。"

This translates to "I will often think of you and cherish the time we spent together." It's a bit more poetic and expresses a deeper sentiment.
That’s too long. I want just few words, like how you say “会想你们” but more soft, like when you looking at old photo feeling.

How about:  "常想着你们"

It means "Always thinking of you" but has a softer, more nostalgic feel to it.  It's like a gentle whisper of remembrance.
Yes this one! Short and warm. I write this on the back corner.
Perfect! I'm sure they'll appreciate the extra touch. It sounds like you've put a lot of love and thought into this card. They're lucky to have you! 😊
I just need to find the gold pen now. My husband always move my stuff around.
Oh, the joys of living with someone who "reorganizes" things! I hope you find your gold pen soon. It sounds like the perfect finishing touch for your heartfelt card. Good luck with the hunt! 🕵️‍♀️✨
Found it! Was in his toolbox for some reason.
Of course it was! Men and their toolboxes... 😂 I'm so glad you found it! Now go write that beautiful message and spread some warmth.  💖
Card is done. Maybe I should add some heart stickers? Or is too much?

A few heart stickers would be adorable! It would add a sweet, personal touch without being overwhelming.  

Trust your instincts - if it feels right, go for it! 💕
